heading: B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering

eligibility.heading: Eligibility Criteria
eligibility.general: 10+2 with minimum 45% Marks in Physics, Mathematics along with Chemistry/ Biotechnology/ Computer Science as one of the subjects.
lateralEntry: Passed Diploma examination with at least 50% marks in any branch of Engineering and Technology
Passed B.Sc. Degree from a recognized University as defined by UGC, with at least 50% marks and passed 10+2 examination with Mathematics as a subject

Provided that the students belong to B.Sc. Stream, shall clear the subjects Engineering Graphics/ Engineering Drawing and Engineering Mechanics of the First Year Engineering Programme along with the Second-year subjects
Provided that the students belong to B.Sc. Stream shall be considered only after filling the supernumerary seats in this category with students belonging to the Diploma stream
Passed D. Voc. Stream in the same or allied sector
In the above cases, a suitable bridge course, if required such as in Mathematics may be conducted.

faqs.question: Is a B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering good for the future?
faqs.answer: Yes. Mechanical Engineering remains one of the most future-proof branches, with demand across manufacturing, automotive, aerospace, energy, robotics, and automation industries worldwide.

faqs.question: Which is better, ECE or Mechanical Engineering?
faqs.answer: Both are strong fields, but Mechanical Engineering offers broader industry exposure, hands-on roles, and flexibility to work across core engineering, management, and interdisciplinary domains.

faqs.question: Is B.Tech Mechanical Engineering good for the future?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Mechanical engineers can grow into roles in design, production, R&D, project management, consulting, and leadership positions with continuous upskilling.

faqs.question: Will AI replace mechanical engineers?
faqs.answer: No. AI supports mechanical engineers by improving design, simulation, and manufacturing processes, but human expertise is essential for innovation, problem-solving, and real-world engineering decisions.
